    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        public void cancel(@NotNull
                   Execution execution)
        Description copied from class: Runner
        Cancels the specified execution if not already run.

        Note that the method will have no effect in case the runner does not maintain a queue or the specified execution has been already processed at the moment of the call.
        Note also that, in case the same execution has been added more than once to the runner queue, when the method returns, the queue will not contain the execution instance anymore, with the consequence that the Runnable.run() method will never be called.

        The implementation of this method is optional, still, it may greatly increase the performance by avoiding to start invocations which are already aborted.

        Specified by:
        cancel in class Runner
        Parameters:
        execution - the execution.

      • isExecutionThread

        public boolean isExecutionThread()
        Description copied from class: Runner
        Checks if the calling thread may be employed to run executions.

        The implementation of this method is not strictly mandatory, even if, the classes always returning false effectively prevent the correct detection of possible deadlocks.
        A synchronous runner implementation will always return true.

        Specified by:
        isExecutionThread in class Runner
        Returns:
        whether the calling thread is employed by the runner.

      • run

        public void run(@NotNull
                Execution execution,
                long delay,
                @NotNull
                TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Description copied from class: Runner
        Runs the specified execution (that is, it calls the Runnable.run() method inside the runner thread).
        Specified by:
        run in class Runner
        Parameters:
        execution - the execution.
        delay - the execution delay.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
